eu_initiatives: ECPAT Belgium acts as the EU Brussels Office of ECPAT International. We follow initiatives, policies and legislation relating to sexual exploitation of children (ex: implementation of Directive 2011/93/EU or Directive 2011/36/11)
organisation_name: End Child Prostitution, Child Pornography and Trafficking of Children for sexual purposes - Belgium (ECPAT Belgium)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
- ECPAT International (www.ecpat.org) 
- European Initiative for Children in Migration (coordinated by PICUM) 
- Belgian French speaking and Flemish speaking coordinations on children's rights 
- STOP Group (Belgian multistakeholder group against sexual exploitation of children in travel and tourism)
goals__remit:
ECPAT Belgium is the Belgian official member of ECPAT International. Our mission is to eradicate the sexual exploitation of children.    
 
We implement a wide range of activities among professionals, individual citizens and children/adolescents :  
1) awareness-raising/prevention such as trainings, campaigns, etc.  
2) advocacy at national and European level 
3) research 
In all our activities, youth participation is an important component such as multi-stakeholder collaboration.
relevant_communication:
- "Stop Sex Trafficking of Children and Young People" - 3 year campaign led by ECPAT International and the Body Shop that led to the handover of 2.3 millions petitions signed by EU citizens against child sex trafficking to Commissionner Malmström (2011) 
- Participation to expert consultation and hearings to prepare Directives 2011/93/EU and 2011/36/EU as well as the EU Strategy towards the eradication of trafficking in human beings 
- Statement/opinions on various topics (protection of migrant children from sexual exploitation, etc.)  
- European research on different aspect of sexual exploitation of children (implementation of Directive 2011/93/EU, on child trafficking, etc.) 
- Organisation of bilateral or multilateral meetings with MEP's, members of the Commission, etc.
